Entre tus responsabilidades principales se encontrar√°n:


Participar√°s en el desarrollo metodol√≥gico de los modelos internos del Grupo Banco Sabadell:


  • Desarrollo de los modelos de calificaci√≥n crediticia tipo rating/scoring, valorando el potencial riesgo del Banco a trav√©s del an√°lisis de datos y la construcci√≥n de modelos predictivos que permitan explicar el perfil y la capacidad de pago de las empresas y personas f√≠sicas.
  • Estimaci√≥n y backtest de los modelos internos de PD (Probability of Default), EAD (Exposure At Default), LGD (Loss Given Default) y otros par√°metros para provisiones (IFRS9), para capital regulatorio (IRB) y para planificaci√≥n financiera (Stress Test, ICAAP).
  • Desarrollo, aplicaci√≥n y seguimiento una vez implementados.
  • Assessment de compliance con est√°ndares de Banco Sabadell y los requerimientos regulatorios.
  • Documentaci√≥n modelos y estimaciones para uso en Banco Sabadell.


Dar√°s soporte en auditor√≠as y validaciones tanto internas como externas (supervisor, auditores externos).


Har√°s mantenimiento y desarrollo de las BBDD:


  • Controles de calidad de datos y conocimiento del proceso.
  • Planteo de requerimientos a IT y validaci√≥n de la implementaci√≥n de los mismos.


¬øQu√© valoramos de tu candidatura?


  • Que tengas estudios superiores en Econom√≠a, Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas, Actuariales, F√≠sica o Ingenier√≠a Superior.


  • Valoraremos formaci√≥n complementaria (Master o Postgrado) con componente cuantitativo y/o acreditaciones como FRM, CQF, Certificaciones en Data Analytics, Modelling, Machine Learning o similar.


  • Experiencia m√≠nima de 1-2 a√±os en funciones vinculadas a modelos de riesgo de cr√©dito (desarrollo, control, seguimiento, coordinaci√≥n, validaci√≥n, auditor√≠a), en sector Banca.


  • Que est√©s habituado y/o aportes experiencia en gesti√≥n de informaci√≥n, an√°lisis de BBDD y elaboraci√≥n de informes, con conocimiento del entorno regulatorio y normativa aplicable a riesgo de cr√©dito.


  • Que conozcas con suficiencia lenguajes de programaci√≥n estad√≠stica (SAS - SQL), as√≠ como dominio del paquete Office. Valoraremos conocimientos de otros lenguajes de programaci√≥n (Phyton, R) y herramientas de BI (Power BI).


  • Que aportes un buen nivel de Ingl√©s (m√≠nimo B2).



Banco Sabadell est√° comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selecci√≥n, formaci√≥n y promoci√≥n ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminaci√≥n por motivo de g√©nero, edad, orientaci√≥n sexual, religi√≥n, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.


Banco Sabadell forma parte de la red de empresas con el distintivo de ‚ÄúIgualdad en la Empresa‚Äù otorgado por el Ministerio de Igualdad.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world‚Äôs largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world‚Äôs curiosity!

Job Description

The Opportunity

As a Data Scientist ‚Äì Platform Intelligence at Cint, reporting to the VP of Data Science and Analytics, you will provide insights to support the development of new products, enhance the performance of existing ones, and deliver data-driven product solutions in collaboration with product and engineering teams.

You will also be working with Commercial, Operations, and Finance teams to understand, analyze, explain, and predict the impact of platform algorithms on clients and partners.

What You Will Do


Develop a comprehensive, predictive understanding of marketplace dynamics, including price elasticity and demand/supply balance, and their underlying mechanics.
Support ad-hoc requests from stakeholders by conducting exploratory analyses to deepen insights into metrics and trends. Perform A/B testing and other experiments as needed.
Define statistical and machine learning methods, establish modeling standards, and drive their development.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and test new and existing products.
Create clear, effective deliverables that communicate insights and recommendations through visualizations and presentations tailored to diverse audiences.


Qualifications

What We Are Looking For


Minimum 2+ years of solid experience in a data science role.
Master's degree or equivalent in Statistics, Quantitative Sciences, Data Science, Operations Research, or a related quantitative field.
Strong ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large datasets.
In-depth understanding of statistical techniques and concepts (e.g., distributions, hypothesis testing, parametric/non-parametric tests, survey design, sampling theory, experimental design, regression, predictive modeling).
Solid knowledge of machine learning techniques (e.g., clustering, regression, decision trees) and their practical applications and limitations.
Experience applying statistical and modeling techniques in real-world scenarios.
Proficient in Python (for statistical and ML tools).
Proficient in SQL and handling large-scale databases.
Comfortable researching and adopting new methods, tools, and techniques


Essential Qualities


Highly accountable self-starter and quick learner, motivated to deliver results
Data driven with the ability to translate abstract requests into actionable initiatives
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain and defend analytical techniques to non-experts
Ability to understand the big picture while ensuring attention to detail


Additional Information

Bonus Points If You Have


Experience with online market research methods/products
Experience in Identity graph methodologies
Experience with Identity vendors
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark)


Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We‚Äôre pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We‚Äôre accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We‚Äôre open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other‚Äôs experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish ‚Äì the world‚Äôs largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region ‚Äì and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid ‚Äì a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Data Scientist - (Hybrid : 2 /week)
Description:
Company Description

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

Job Description

Our Media Measurement team uses state-of-the-art technologies and rigorous methods to track who is watching what, where, and how they engage with content. Our clients can evaluate who is consuming what content across different media, platforms and devices, and know what the audience thinks about that content. As people consume media content on more channels, and through more devices, than ever before, we are proud to provide a full view on media consumption to our clients.

You will:


Own together with your team several of our Data Science solutions throughout the full life cycle (brainstorming, design, implementation, productization and maintenance)
Develop solutions based on data science, stats and machine learning models
Improve methods and tools and contribute to our communities of practice in the area of Data Science
Communicate with non-data scientists in Tech, Operations, Commercial, Product and understand the domain and the requirements
Make data your best friends. Understand their strengths and use them. Be aware of their weaknesses and handle those in your solutions
Screen the market for potential new Data Science approaches
Foster knowledge exchange within the company
Present GfK's Data Science expertise at conferences and workshops


Qualifications

You have:


2+ years of relevant experience
a Master's degree / PhD that reflects modeling and statistics skills
The ability to communicate complex methodology and technology to tech and non-tech audiences
Expert statistical / machine learning modeling skills (e.g. statistical tests, classification, predictive modelling, handling of missing data, sampling, weighting)
Experience with an analytical programming language (Python, R) and the respective ecosystem


It would be a nice addition if you have:


Knowledge of cloud computing environments and tooling (especially AWS)
Advanced software development skills (unit testing, CI/CD, Git)
Basic skills regarding database handling as SQL
Basic knowledge of the always evolving Data Science ecosystem and its frameworks


Additional Information

Benefits:


A meaningful project, where you learn every day and show the team what you've got.
The possibility to be part of a talented team, working with experienced individuals.
A nice place to work, where we foster training, and personal development.
Flex Office: a mix of remote and in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a healthy work-life balance


Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

HTML:
L'Hospital Sant Joan de D√©u Barcelona √©s un dels centres europeus m√©s importants en les especialitats de Pediatria, Ginecologia i Obstetr√≠cia. Som un hospital d'alta especialitzaci√≥ i tecnologia, de refer√®ncia en l'assist√®ncia, la doc√®ncia i la recerca. El nostre model assistencial compagina harm√≤nicament la ci√®ncia, els aven√ßos t√®cnics i la humanitzaci√≥, des del respecte a la dignitat de la persona. Anualment ens visiten m√©s de 350.000 pacients.

L‚Äôhospital, com a centre de refer√®ncia internacional, aposta per una assist√®ncia i tractament del pacient humanista que te en compte l‚Äôexperi√®ncia del pacient en tots els √†mbits del tractament. Al ser un centre d‚Äôalta especialitzaci√≥, tamb√© integra les √∫ltimes tecnologies en el tractament i seguiment dels pacients. Un exemple √©s el projecte Hospital L√≠quid, el projecte de transformaci√≥ digital que inici√† el 2009 i que se centra en generar les eines i plataformes que permetin anar m√©s enll√† de les parets de l‚Äôhospital per tractar als pacients all√† on siguin i empoderar-los en el proc√©s de tractament. En el projecte PHEMS desenvoluparem i validarem un concepte d'ecosistema de dades de salut descentralitzat i obert, basat en est√†ndard (com el OMOP) i generat sobre 3 casos d‚Äô√∫s cl√≠nic de 4 hospital de refer√®ncia en l‚Äôassist√®ncia pedi√†trica a Europa. El projecte facilitar√† l'acc√©s a les dades de salut i ajudar√† a avan√ßar en l'an√†lisi avan√ßat de dades de federades,creant serveis que generen conjunts de dades sint√®tiques compartibles.

El projecte PHEMS ha estat finan√ßat per la Comissi√≥ Europea dins del programa Horizon Europe (Research and Innovation Action) i sota el grant agreement n¬∫ 101094195.

Els socis t√®cnics, en col¬∑laboraci√≥ amb els socis hospitalaris (HUS - Helsinki, GOSH -Londres, ERASMUS-Rotterdam y HSJD-Barcelona) desenvoluparan tres casos d'√∫s cl√≠nic, que utilitzaran diversos tipus de dades (per exemple, dades d'EHR, de laboratori i de monitoratge):

  • Benchmarking del tractament de pacients de cardiologia amb cardiopatia cong√®nita: Aquesta patologies s√≥n de les m√©s complexes i costoses pel sistemes de salud, suposant tractament quir√∫rgics, est√†ncies en UCIs i seguiments a domicili. En aquest cas d‚Äô√∫s es crear√† un dashboard per comparar les mesures de resultats dels pacients amb cardiologia mitjan√ßant l'√∫s de dades federades i estandarditzades (OMOP) de GOSH, HUS, FSJD i ERASMUS. Aquestes dades de benchmarking s'utilitzaran per identificar les millors pr√†ctiques en les vies de tractament per millorar l'atenci√≥ i la prestaci√≥ assistencial dels pacients amb cardiopatia cong√®nita.
  • Predicci√≥ de S√®psia de la Unitat de Cures Intensives Pedi√†triques (UCIP): El cas d'√∫s cl√≠nic 2 investigar√† els beneficis de l'ecosistema federat PHEMS per desenvolupar, entrenar i provar algorismes que prediuen la s√®psia en UCIP de quatre grans hospitals infantils europeus (HUS, GOSH, ERASMUS y HSJD). Validar i implementar algorismes predictius de s√®psia aplicant t√®cniques d'aprenentatge autom√†tic per agrupar traject√≤ries de pacients de UCIP segons els resultats.
  • Hematologia; hemof√≠lia: El cas d'√∫s cl√≠nic 3 desenvolupar√† i provar√† un algorisme de predicci√≥ basat en Machine Learning en conjunts de dades de GOSH, HUS, FSJD i ERASMUS per tractar pacients pedi√†trics amb hemof√≠lia A o B. Aquest cas d'√∫s pret√©n mostrar que l'ecosistema d'intercanvi de dades de nova creaci√≥, mitjan√ßant algorismes d'aprenentatge federats, augmenta el nombre de pacients inclosos en algorismes d'aprenentatge autom√†tic en malalties de baixa incid√®ncia. Millorarem la precisi√≥ d'un algorisme d'aprenentatge autom√†tic creat per un √∫nic centre (ERASMUS) per predir els nivells de factor plasm√†tic a l'hemof√≠lia A i B ampliant la validaci√≥ als altres 3 centres. Tamb√© millorarem els models de farmacocin√®tica (PK) existents per predir els nivells de factor plasm√†tic. Finalment, compararem el rendiment dels models d'aprenentatge autom√†tic amb els models cl√†ssics de PK per predir els nivells de factor plasm√†tic.


L'objectiu d'aquest lloc de treball √©s incorporar un/a data scientist a l‚Äôequip multidisciplinar del projecte per donar suport transversal als tres casos d‚Äô√∫s cl√≠nics en qu√® el HSJD participa. Per√≤ especialment en el desenvolupament del algoritme de predicci√≥ de Sepsis en UCIP.

EL PROJECTE A DESENVOLUPAR:

Donar suport al projecte PHEMS com a referent bioinform√†tic en la preparaci√≥ de les bases de dades dels 3 casos de us i en el desenvolupament e implementaci√≥ de models predictius de SEPSIS en UCIP, coordinat amb els 4 hospitals de refer√®ncia pedi√†trics.

LES RESPONSABILITATS:

  • Utilitzaci√≥ de les eines de preprocessat i an√†lisi de dades per donar resposta a les necessitats del projecte.
  • Desenvolupament i validaci√≥ d‚Äôalgoritmes predictius explicables per a la predicci√≥ del risc de deteriorament de pacients i la seva estratificaci√≥ segons risc.
  • Col¬∑laboraci√≥ en el disseny de les eines de visualitzaci√≥ per a la presentaci√≥ d‚Äôinformaci√≥ amb els entorns definits per l¬¥organitzaci√≥.
  • Col¬∑laboraci√≥ en el posada en producci√≥ del algoritme un cop validat, pel seu √∫s en un entorn cl√≠nic real.
  • Gestionar, coordinar i impartir las formacions relacionades amb les seves tasques i √†rees de coneixement al personal que els requereixi.
  • Donar suport a les √†rees t√®cniques i assistencials que formin part de l‚Äô√†mbit d‚Äôactuaci√≥.

  • Reportar l‚Äôactivitat del seu √†mbit d‚Äôactuaci√≥, garantint l‚Äôalineaci√≥ dels indicadors de resultats amb els objectius tant assistencials com estrat√®gics de l‚Äô√†rea on treballi.
  • Contribuir als entregables del projecte Europeu amb els resultats i documentaci√≥ generada del projecte
  • Participaci√≥ i coordinaci√≥ en les reunions de seguiment i equip del projecte.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world‚Äôs largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world‚Äôs curiosity!

Job Description

The Opportunity

As a Data Scientist ‚Äì Platform Intelligence at Cint, reporting to the VP of Data Science and Analytics, you will provide insights to support the development of new products, enhance the performance of existing ones, and deliver data-driven product solutions in collaboration with product and engineering teams.

You will also be working with Commercial, Operations, and Finance teams to understand, analyze, explain, and predict the impact of platform algorithms on clients and partners.

What You Will Do


Develop a comprehensive, predictive understanding of marketplace dynamics, including price elasticity and demand/supply balance, and their underlying mechanics.
Support ad-hoc requests from stakeholders by conducting exploratory analyses to deepen insights into metrics and trends. Perform A/B testing and other experiments as needed.
Define statistical and machine learning methods, establish modeling standards, and drive their development.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and test new and existing products.
Create clear, effective deliverables that communicate insights and recommendations through visualizations and presentations tailored to diverse audiences.


Qualifications

What We Are Looking For


Minimum 2+ years of solid experience in a data science role.
Master's degree or equivalent in Statistics, Quantitative Sciences, Data Science, Operations Research, or a related quantitative field.
Strong ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large datasets.
In-depth understanding of statistical techniques and concepts (e.g., distributions, hypothesis testing, parametric/non-parametric tests, survey design, sampling theory, experimental design, regression, predictive modeling).
Solid knowledge of machine learning techniques (e.g., clustering, regression, decision trees) and their practical applications and limitations.
Experience applying statistical and modeling techniques in real-world scenarios.
Proficient in Python (for statistical and ML tools).
Proficient in SQL and handling large-scale databases.
Comfortable researching and adopting new methods, tools, and techniques


Essential Qualities


Highly accountable self-starter and quick learner, motivated to deliver results
Data driven with the ability to translate abstract requests into actionable initiatives
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain and defend analytical techniques to non-experts
Ability to understand the big picture while ensuring attention to detail


Additional Information

Bonus Points If You Have


Experience with online market research methods/products
Experience in Identity graph methodologies
Experience with Identity vendors
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark)


Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We‚Äôre pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We‚Äôre accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We‚Äôre open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other‚Äôs experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish ‚Äì the world‚Äôs largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region ‚Äì and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid ‚Äì a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: ML/AI Engineer
Description:
Your mission

As an ML/AI Engineer at Astrafy, you will work on various projects to help our customers build, deploy, and scale ML/AI models in production. You will collaborate closely with both technical and business teams to create tailored ML/AI solutions.

On The Business Side


Engage with stakeholders to understand the business objectives and identify ML/AI opportunities.
Analyze available data sources to assess feasibility and design model deployment strategies.
Define and align project goals with measurable KPIs.


On The Technical Side


Design and develop machine learning models using PyTorch, TensorFlow and other frameworks.
Implement MLOps practices to automate the training and deployment and monitoring of models using tools like Kubeflow
Build scalable pipelines for model training, testing, and deployment.
Ensure that models are fully automated, from data preprocessing to production deployment.
Collaborate with data engineers and other stakeholders to optimize model performance.


In addition to these responsibilities, Astrafy values knowledge sharing and thought leadership. We actively contribute to platforms like Medium and LinkedIn, publishing articles and sharing insights to grow our community and industry presence.

You will be encouraged to contribute by writing articles that enhance Astrafy‚Äôs impact and foster collaboration across the industry.

Your profile


Proficiency in machine learning algorithms, model development, and deployment
Strong understanding of MLOps practices for automating the full model lifecycle
Experience with Google Cloud, particularly Vertex AI and BigQuery
Experience working on solutions using LLMs especially in Retrieval Augmented Generation
Strong programming skills in Python and frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Familiarity with data preprocessing, model tuning, and performance optimization
Attention to detail and quality with excellent problem-solving
You have an analytics and solution-oriented mindset
You work well in a team as well as independently
Excellent communication and collaboration skills (both with your colleagues as well as with external stakeholders)
You are fluent in English; knowledge of French or Spanish is a plus
Ability to work independently and in teams, with excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Experience with LangChain, LangGraph, dbt is a plus
You must be eligible to work in Europe


This role is not just a job; it's an opportunity to be at the forefront of the data revolution, helping companies unlock the potential of ML/AI technologies. If you are passionate about ML/AI, thrive in dynamic environments, and are eager to make a significant impact, we would love to hear from you.

Was this list a bit much? Don't worry - we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning.

Why us?


An attractive salary package, with no blurry or hidden clauses. Everything we offer is open-source via our Gitbook. Check it out here (https://astrafy.gitbook.io/handbook/its-all-about-people/compensation).
An exciting job where technology innovation is not a buzzword but a reality.
Be part of a dynamic team that shares strong values. Check out our ‚ÄúCulture and Values‚Äù chart here (https://docs.astrafy.io/handbook/the-company/culture-and-values).
Continuous training & development of soft and hard skills. Check out our training policy here (https://docs.astrafy.io/handbook/its-all-about-people/training).
Flexible working hours and remote policies. Check it out here (https://docs.astrafy.io/handbook/the-company/remote-work).
An excellent team of colleagues & regular team-building activities. Check it out here (https://docs.astrafy.io/handbook/its-all-about-people/team-building-and-retreat).


And much more. We have compiled a detailed handbook covering all you need to know about our company. Check it out here (https://docs.astrafy.io/handbook/).

About Us

Our mission is to help companies and individuals solve data analytics problems by covering the full spectrum of the data journey (from ingestion, transformation and finally distribution of data to downstream applications) with a Modern Data Stack. Most companies are lacking internal knowledge to leverage the limitless power of emerging Modern Data Stack tools and our goal is to educate them and implement powerful solutions with those technologies.

We achieve this by creating a new type of consulting company:


Embracing a culture that prioritizes creativity and strategic thinking
Incorporating education as one of our key output in each project we deliver
Ensuring the growth and well-being of our employees


Regarding our technology stack, we are a Google Cloud partner and host most of our solutions on Google Cloud. On the data side, we are relying on a Modern Data Stack and are savvy users of dbt, Airflow and Airbyte. We are always on the lookout for the best technologies and adapt ourselves quickly to market trends.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - AI Inteligencia Artificial
Description:
The Digital Business Team develops promising digital solutions for global products and processes. It aims to organize Applus+ Laboratories' information, making it useful, fast, and reliable for both the Applus+ Group and its clients. The team‚Äôs mission is to be recognized as the most digital, innovative, and customer-oriented company, reducing digital operations' costs while increasing the value and portfolio of services.




We are looking for a Data Science / AI Engineer to join our Digital team and contribute to the development of evolving data products and applications.




What are we are looking for?

Collect, organize, and analyze information to generate code, train models, verify and validate outputs, and draw meaningful conclusions.
Have strong mathematical fundamentals and be proficient in numerical and statistical methods, as well as a variety of machine learning algorithms.
Bring expertise in NLP and foundation models, with specific knowledge in transformers, tokenization, and encoding-decoding processes.
Apply Explainable AI methodologies and use related Python libraries (e.g., SHAP, LIME).
Demonstrate organized thinking, strong logic and reasoning skills, and effective communication, ensuring knowledge sharing through documentation and well-commented code.
Possess a keen eye for detail to identify anomalies in data and code.
Exhibit creativity and an "out-of-the-box" approach to problem-solving.




Requirements:

Demonstrated experience coding in python specifically working in data science projects and using ML most common libraries.
2+ year experience in ML / AI projects.
Strong knowledge in machine learning / deep learning fundamentals and techniques.
Specific knowledge on Computer Linguistics may be an advantage: NLP libraries like Spacy or NLTK, genAI frameworks such as LangChain and/or LlamaIndex, chunking, tokenization, embeddings...
Specific expertness on foundation models will be considered.
Previous experiences working with Generative AI and explainable AI are welcome.




Our current tech stack is:

Python
Commonly used ML/AI libraries
Azure AI
Java




Technical Requirements

Proven coding experience (e.g., Python; other languages are a plus) in data science projects and familiarity with common ML libraries.
Hands-on experience in ML/AI projects (preferred).
Solid knowledge of data mining, machine learning, and deep learning fundamentals and techniques.
Familiarity with computer linguistics: NLP libraries (e.g., SpaCy, NLTK), generative AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex), tokenization, embeddings, and chunking.
Expertise in foundation models and previous work with Generative AI and Explainable AI is an advantage.

Education

Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
A master‚Äôs degree in Data Science or AI Engineering is an advantage.

Languages

Fluent in Spanish and English.




If you are passionate about neural networks, advanced AI algorithms, and challenging yourself, this is the right job for you!

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
If you are looking for an opportunity for your career, this is your time to shine! We are now looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our team.

At Marbill, we are passionate about empowering our business to succeed in the competitive world of e-commerce. Our innovative software solutions help merchants manage customers, mitigate risk, process payments, and enhance service offerings, ultimately optimizing their financial results.




Responsibilities:

Build data models, algorithms, and simulations to optimize customer experiences, revenue, and ad targeting.
Use data mining and analysis techniques to improve product development, marketing, risk assessment, and business strategies.
Collaborate with different teams to implement models and monitor results.
Create tools to track model performance and data accuracy.




Qualifications:

Graduate degree in Data Science, Maths, Statistics or related field.
Strong skills in mathematical analysis, statistics and mathematical modeling.
Strong understanding and experience with Machine Learning models and Deep Learning models.
2-4 years of proven experience with Python.
Experience in SQL and AWS.
Clear communication skills to work effectively with different teams.




Why us?

We are a functional organization where individuals work hard with flexibility and common sense

to maintain a healthy and balanced lifestyle. Our team consists of tenacious, resilient, and

accountable professionals from over 30 countries. We embrace new ideas and challenges with

a solution-oriented mindset and high energy. We equip our people with the tools they need to

deliver results and stay focused on what truly matters.

We offer:

Flexible working hours,
Hybrid or office based positions,
Competitive salary based on the interview and regular salary reviews,
All the training needed for your role,
5 days of annual leave,
Health Insurance after 3 months of employment (for permanent employees).

And if you join us in the office:

Lunch & snacks,
Parking if needed,
Sunshine almost every day.

Title: Data Scientist - (Hybrid : 2 /week)
Description:
Company Description

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

Job Description

Our Media Measurement team uses state-of-the-art technologies and rigorous methods to track who is watching what, where, and how they engage with content. Our clients can evaluate who is consuming what content across different media, platforms and devices, and know what the audience thinks about that content. As people consume media content on more channels, and through more devices, than ever before, we are proud to provide a full view on media consumption to our clients.

You will:


Own together with your team several of our Data Science solutions throughout the full life cycle (brainstorming, design, implementation, productization and maintenance)
Develop solutions based on data science, stats and machine learning models
Improve methods and tools and contribute to our communities of practice in the area of Data Science
Communicate with non-data scientists in Tech, Operations, Commercial, Product and understand the domain and the requirements
Make data your best friends. Understand their strengths and use them. Be aware of their weaknesses and handle those in your solutions
Screen the market for potential new Data Science approaches
Foster knowledge exchange within the company
Present GfK's Data Science expertise at conferences and workshops


Qualifications

You have:


2+ years of relevant experience
a Master's degree / PhD that reflects modeling and statistics skills
The ability to communicate complex methodology and technology to tech and non-tech audiences
Expert statistical / machine learning modeling skills (e.g. statistical tests, classification, predictive modelling, handling of missing data, sampling, weighting)
Experience with an analytical programming language (Python, R) and the respective ecosystem


It would be a nice addition if you have:


Knowledge of cloud computing environments and tooling (especially AWS)
Advanced software development skills (unit testing, CI/CD, Git)
Basic skills regarding database handling as SQL
Basic knowledge of the always evolving Data Science ecosystem and its frameworks


Additional Information

Benefits:


A meaningful project, where you learn every day and show the team what you've got.
The possibility to be part of a talented team, working with experienced individuals.
A nice place to work, where we foster training, and personal development.
Flex Office: a mix of remote and in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a healthy work-life balance


Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

HTML:
Company Description

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

Job Description

Our Media Measurement team uses state-of-the-art technologies and rigorous methods to track who is watching what, where, and how they engage with content. Our clients can evaluate who is consuming what content across different media, platforms and devices, and know what the audience thinks about that content. As people consume media content on more channels, and through more devices, than ever before, we are proud to provide a full view on media consumption to our clients.

You will:

  • Own together with your team several of our Data Science solutions throughout the full life cycle (brainstorming, design, implementation, productization and maintenance)
  • Develop solutions based on data science, stats and machine learning models
  • Improve methods and tools and contribute to our communities of practice in the area of Data Science
  • Communicate with non-data scientists in Tech, Operations, Commercial, Product and understand the domain and the requirements
  • Make data your best friends. Understand their strengths and use them. Be aware of their weaknesses and handle those in your solutions
  • Screen the market for potential new Data Science approaches
  • Foster knowledge exchange within the company
  • Present GfK's Data Science expertise at conferences and workshops

Qualifications

You have:

  • 2+ years of relevant experience
  • a Master's degree / PhD that reflects modeling and statistics skills
  • The ability to communicate complex methodology and technology to tech and non-tech audiences
  • Expert statistical / machine learning modeling skills (e.g. statistical tests, classification, predictive modelling, handling of missing data, sampling, weighting)
  • Experience with an analytical programming language (Python, R) and the respective ecosystem

It would be a nice addition if you have:

  • Knowledge of cloud computing environments and tooling (especially AWS)
  • Advanced software development skills (unit testing, CI/CD, Git)
  • Basic skills regarding database handling as SQL
  • Basic knowledge of the always evolving Data Science ecosystem and its frameworks

Additional Information

Benefits:

  • A meaningful project, where you learn every day and show the team what you've got.
  • The possibility to be part of a talented team, working with experienced individuals.
  • A nice place to work, where we foster training, and personal development.
  • Flex Office: a mix of remote and in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a healthy work-life balance

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Description:
Somos Banco Sabadell




Banco Sabadell es una de las principales entidades bancarias en Espa√±a con m√°s de 14.000 personas caracterizadas por nuestra implicaci√≥n, esp√≠ritu de colaboraci√≥n y dinamismo. ¬°√önete a nosotros!




¬øQu√© estamos buscando?




Actualmente buscamos un perfil proactivo y con iniciativa, que tenga curiosidad y clara orientaci√≥n a la resoluci√≥n de problemas, con capacidad anal√≠tica y de auto-organizaci√≥n y que sepa trabajar en equipo.




Hablemos del proyecto‚Ä¶




Los modelos de riesgos evolucionan cada d√≠a gracias al aumento en la disponibilidad y capacidad de an√°lisis de datos, permitiendo el desarrollo de nuevas herramientas cuantitativas √∫tiles para la gesti√≥n y toma de decisiones. Esto, junto con las m√∫ltiples exigencias regulatorias sobre el sector bancario, hace que exista una amplia variedad de tareas que requieren un alto grado de implicaci√≥n por su complejidad.




La Direcci√≥n de Modelos de Riesgo tiene como misi√≥n dar soporte a las diversas √°reas encargadas de la modelizaci√≥n del riesgo de cr√©dito en Banco Sabadell participando transversalmente de forma activa en los diversos procesos dentro del ciclo de vida de un modelo (an√°lisis de datos, modelizaci√≥n, validaci√≥n, implantaci√≥n y seguimiento), principalmente en la construcci√≥n de las herramientas de calificaci√≥n (rating/scoring) y en la estimaci√≥n de los par√°metros de riesgo (PD, LGD y EAD) para el c√°lculo de capital y provisiones del Grupo Banco Sabadell.




Entre tus responsabilidades principales se encontrar√°n:

Desarrollo de los modelos de calificaci√≥n crediticia tipo rating/scoring, valorando el potencial riesgo del Banco a trav√©s del an√°lisis de datos y la construcci√≥n de modelos predictivos que permitan explicar el perfil y la capacidad de pago de las empresas y personas f√≠sicas.
Estimaci√≥n y backtest de los modelos internos de PD (Probability of Default), EAD (Exposure At Default), LGD (Loss Given Default) y otros par√°metros para provisiones (IFRS9), para capital regulatorio (IRB) y para planificaci√≥n financiera (Stress Test, ICAAP).
Desarrollo, aplicaci√≥n y seguimiento una vez implementados.
Assessment de compliance con est√°ndares de Banco Sabadell y los requerimientos regulatorios.
Documentaci√≥n modelos y estimaciones para uso en Banco Sabadell.




Dar√°s soporte en auditor√≠as y validaciones tanto internas como externas (supervisor, auditores externos).




Har√°s mantenimiento y desarrollo de las BBDD:




Controles de calidad de datos y conocimiento del proceso.
Planteo de requerimientos a IT y validaci√≥n de la implementaci√≥n de los mismos.




¬øQu√© valoramos de tu candidatura?




Que tengas estudios superiores en Econom√≠a, Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas, Actuariales, F√≠sica o Ingenier√≠a Superior.




Valoraremos formaci√≥n complementaria (Master o Postgrado) con componente cuantitativo y/o acreditaciones como FRM, CQF, Certificaciones en Data Analytics, Modelling, Machine Learning o similar.




Experiencia m√≠nima de 1-2 a√±os en funciones vinculadas a modelos de riesgo de cr√©dito (desarrollo, control, seguimiento, coordinaci√≥n, validaci√≥n, auditor√≠a), en sector Banca.




Que est√©s habituado y/o aportes experiencia en gesti√≥n de informaci√≥n, an√°lisis de BBDD y elaboraci√≥n de informes, con conocimiento del entorno regulatorio y normativa aplicable a riesgo de cr√©dito.




Que conozcas con suficiencia lenguajes de programaci√≥n estad√≠stica (SAS - SQL), as√≠ como dominio del paquete Office. Valoraremos conocimientos de otros lenguajes de programaci√≥n (Phyton, R) y herramientas de BI (Power BI).




Que aportes un buen nivel de Ingl√©s (m√≠nimo B2).







Banco Sabadell est√° comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selecci√≥n, formaci√≥n y promoci√≥n ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminaci√≥n por motivo de g√©nero, edad, orientaci√≥n sexual, religi√≥n, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world‚Äôs visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions ‚Äì and our methods for creating them ‚Äì help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.




Join Keysight's central AI-Hub in Barcelona, a newly formed division dedicated to innovation and excellence in machine learning. We are at the forefront of AI research, driving advancements in supervised and unsupervised learning, generative models, temporal learning, multimodal input streams, deep reinforcement learning, inverse reinforcement learning, and large language models. At Keysight, we are passionate about pushing the boundaries of what is possible.




About the Team:

You will be joining the Eggplant Team, where we empower organizations to create exceptional digital experiences. Businesses across the globe rely on Eggplant to outpace competitors, enhance productivity, and delight their customers. How? By transforming the quality, responsiveness, and performance of software applications across various interfaces, platforms, browsers, and devices‚Äîincluding mobile, IoT, and desktop‚Äîin agile, DevOps, and innovative application and data environments.







About the Role:

We are looking for a talented and experienced AI/ML Engineer with expertise in Generative AI and Natural Language Processing (NLP) to join our Eggplant GenAI Agile team. In this role, you will design, develop, and implement cutting-edge AI solutions that enhance our Eggplant test automation tool, helping businesses revolutionize their software testing processes.

You‚Äôll work closely with a multidisciplinary team‚Äîincluding Product Managers, Frontend and Backend Engineers, and QA professionals‚Äîto integrate AI features that align with our ambitious product roadmap.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, fine-tune, and deploy large language models (LLMs) and Generative AI systems to address real-world business needs, such as automating text generation, Gherkin scenarios, and test cases.
Assess and compare NLP techniques and Generative AI platforms through rigorous qualitative and quantitative analysis.
Continuously monitor model performance, implementing retraining and improvements to ensure accuracy, robustness, and scalability.
Stay at the forefront of AI advancements, applying research insights to develop innovative solutions.
Develop comprehensive AI/ML solution design documents in alignment with requirements detailed in Jira tickets.
Maintain clear, accessible documentation of models, experiments, and processes to promote knowledge sharing and collaboration.
Provide mentorship to peers and junior team members, fostering their growth in AI/ML expertise.




About You:

Our technical solutions ‚Äì and our methods for creating them ‚Äì help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.


Join Keysight's central AI-Hub in Barcelona, a newly formed division dedicated to innovation and excellence in machine learning. We are at the forefront of AI research, driving advancements in supervised and unsupervised learning, generative models, temporal learning, multimodal input streams, deep reinforcement learning, inverse reinforcement learning, and large language models. At Keysight, we are passionate about pushing the boundaries of what is possible.

Title: Data Scientist - Personalizaci√≥n
Description:
Estamos buscando un/a Data Scientist para unirse a nuestro equipo de Data&Advanced Analytics.

Formar√°s parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. El equipo de Advanced Analytics desarrolla algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial dirigidos a optimizar los procesos y decisiones m√°s desafiantes dentro de la industria del retail.




El equipo de Advanced Analytics de Mango est√° formado por Data Scientists, Big Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Deep Learning Researchers y Software Engineers que trabajan juntos en squads multidisciplinares para desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje autom√°tico de calidad de vanguardia aprovechando la √∫ltima tecnolog√≠a en plataformas de Big Data y computaci√≥n distribuida.




Cada uno de los squads de an√°lisis avanzado tiene como objetivo desarrollar y evolucionar algoritmos de aprendizaje autom√°tico para hacer frente a algunos de los principales retos t√©cnicos y empresariales de Mango:




- Personalization Squad: Equipo al que se incorporar√° la persona seleccionada y que es responsable de desarrollar algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial para proporcionar una experiencia personalizada a los clientes de Mango, tanto en el sitio web y la app como en las comunicaciones por email. Aprovechando el gran volumen de datos de compras y de navegaci√≥n de los clientes, los algoritmos desarrollados incluyen recomendaciones de productos, segmentaciones de clientes o la generaci√≥n de contenido personalizado mediante IA generativa, asegurando su despliegue en tiempo real.




- Generative Artificial Intelligence squad: Impulsar iniciativas innovadoras relacionadas con algoritmos generativos (texto, imagen, video, etc). Este squad ha liderado el desarrollo de la plataforma de IA basada en LLM para los casos de uso internos. Adem√°s, es responsable de impulsar la transformaci√≥n que se est√° llevando a cabo en los procesos creativos empleando modelos de IA de generaci√≥n de im√°genes.




- Pricing and Mark-Down Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje autom√°tico que determinen las promociones y descuentos √≥ptimos para optimizar el margen de la empresa durante el periodo de ventas.




- Purchasing/Production Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de ciencia de datos para la detecci√≥n temprana de best-sellers y para determinar cu√°ntas unidades de cada producto y talla debe fabricar Mango durante la planificaci√≥n de la temporada.

Debido a la relevancia de los proyectos de Mango Advanced Analytics, cada squad tiene visibilidad y presentaciones a nivel de junta directiva.




¬øC√ìMO ES NUESTRO EQUIPO?




En Mango nos inspira y une nuestra pasi√≥n por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos presentes en 118 pa√≠ses y nuestra presencia online se extiende a m√°s de 80 pa√≠ses. Nuestro equipo est√° formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades, de las cuales el 80% son mujeres.

Somos un equipo muy din√°mico, motivado por las nuevas tecnolog√≠as, con pasi√≥n por lo que hacemos y ganas de asumir grandes retos que nos permitan seguir creciendo y aportando valor a trav√©s de los datos.




¬øQU√â HACE UN DATA SCIENTIST EN MANGO?




Como Data Scientist formar√°s parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. Trabajar√°s desarrollando soluciones de Inteligencia Artificial desarrolladas con modelos de datos y algoritmos de √∫ltima generaci√≥n. Estos productos de datos permiten casos de uso muy innovadores en el espacio del retail, como la geoanal√≠tica, la robotizaci√≥n, la personalizaci√≥n omnicanal, la tienda conectada, la visi√≥n por ordenador, el consumidor 360¬∫ y las decisiones en tiempo real.

Title: Data Scientist - Supply Chain
Description:
Based in Spain - Madrid or Barcelona - with flexibility for hybrid work arrangements (2 days on, 3 days off). Do not fail to apply if you are not Spanish and live outside Spain! As long as you have permission to work in the country .







We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist with expertise in AI and Machine Learning (ML) and hands-on experience with cloud-based platforms.




In this role, you will develop and deploy scalable AI models to solve critical business challenges, with a specific focus on Supply Chain Planning.




Your work will enhance forecasting accuracy, optimize inventory management, and support decision-making processes through predictive analytics, ultimately driving efficiency and value across supply chain operations.




Key Responsibilities :




As the Data Scientist you will be responsible for selling and developing projects in Supply Chain Planning with focus on:







Develop and deploy AI and ML solutions tailored to supply chain challenges, such as demand forecasting, inventory optimization, and scenario planning.




Leverage advanced analytics to analyse large datasets, identify trends, segment products, and evaluate the impact of promotions and campaigns.




Evaluate and implement AI vendor solutions, assessing their strengths, maturity, and suitability for specific supply chain use cases.




Design and implement predictive and prescriptive models that integrate with data lakes, external sources, and transactional systems.




Collaborate with stakeholders to align AI/ML models with key business objectives, ensuring actionable insights and measurable value.




Present findings and recommendations effectively to technical and non-technical audiences, enabling data-driven decision-making.




Participate in international projects with important clients in the Industry sector (Retail, Consumer Products, Life Science & Healthcare, Automotive, Heavy Manufacturing‚Ä¶)







Required Skills :







1+ years of previous experience in large-scale AI/ML project implementations.




AI and Machine Learning Expertise: Proven experience in developing AI and ML models for supply chain use cases, such as forecasting, segmentation, and optimization.




Supply Chain Knowledge: Interest in supply chain and operations functions (planning, sourcing & procurement, warehousing logistics, transportations, manufacturing, etc.).




Cloud Platforms: Advanced proficiency in deploying solutions on AWS, Azure, or GCP, ensuring scalability and seamless integration.




Technical Proficiency: Programming skills in Python, PySpark, and SQL, with a solid understanding of data pipelines and cloud-native architectures.




AI Vendor Knowledge: Deep familiarity with leading AI vendors and their tools, with knowledge of implementation examples across sectors.




Data Architecture: Expertise in integrating AI/ML solutions with data lakes, external sources, and ERP systems to create end-to-end architectures.




Fluent in English and Spanish










At NTT DATA, we are committed to a flexible work model with the possibility of working both in person in our offices, as well as with full remote and hybrid options.




We have a personalised career model with a six-monthly salary review plus a package of social benefits (flex aid, health insurance and life insurance), a clear commitment to continuous training (technical, methodological and competency), access to certifications, different work modalities (including teleworking), work-life balance (flexible working hours and intensive working hours on Fridays and the summer months) and social benefits (life insurance, mutual health insurance and flexible aid that will allow you to allocate your flexible remuneration to whatever you need).




Do you want to meet us?




NTT DATA is all the people who make it up. A team of more than 139,000 professionals, as diverse as the 50 countries in which we are present are.







Our mission? To offer technological, business, strategy, development and maintenance solutions of applications, being a benchmark in consulting. All thanks to the collaboration between teams, the human quality of our people and the fact that we do not settle for the established, we always seek innovation that brings us closer to the future. Our talent has made us proudly say that we are one of the 9 TOP technology companies in the world.

Title: Junior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Junior ML Engineer




Are you a Software Engineer looking to expand your expertise into the exciting world of Machine Learning and AI? At MOSAIC, we specialize in predictive, optimization, and simulation solutions for the mobility and logistics sectors, leveraging Big Data, Machine Learning, and AI.




About Us:

Mosaic Factor is a Barcelona based startup with currently 12 employees. We were founded in April of 2016 by an agile development believer, a technology guru and a sustainability dreamer who had a vision to exploit the power of data to improve the lives of others. Our software-as-a-service products help understanding and improving flows of people and goods, respect people privacy and business sensitivity and soon develop more robust and fair AI. Data is at centre of all our activities. If you‚Äôre looking for a startup company that values transparency, empathy, personal AND professional growth, but still knows how to have some fun - we‚Äôre the company for you. We‚Äôre disrupting the world‚Äôs largest market - the world you and we live in. Our team is expanding slowly but steadily, and we want you to help us continue our growth.




What we‚Äôll do for you:

We practice the golden rule - we treat you as you want to be treated. We only hire people we trust (seriously it‚Äôs written in our core values), so from day one, you‚Äôll be treated as an expert with valid opinions. You‚Äôll work with us, not for us. We want to help you achieve your goals, while you help us achieve ours. We have a relaxed and flexible small business work environment with tons of opportunity for growth and upward mobility. We‚Äôve also got you covered with full health benefits, vacation, and paid holidays. In short, we let you be‚Ä¶ well... You!

‚Ä¢ Competitive compensation including Medical Insurance, Restaurants and Transport cards

‚Ä¢ Continuous learning and customised training

‚Ä¢ Fun Work Environment and Casual Dress Code

‚Ä¢ Hybrid work, mostly remote

‚Ä¢ Flexible Schedule




Who you are:

You combine logic and organisational skills and pragmatic creativity and a problem solving mentality. you are a curious and adaptable software engineer ready to develop your skills in both back-end development and AI. This role is ideal for a software engineer eager to explore AI-driven solutions and develop their skills in cutting-edge technologies.

You will work closely with data scientists, product managers, and other engineers to design robust back-end applications and gradually integrate advanced ML models into production environments. You‚Äôll fit in here if you are hardworking, know how to have a good chuckle and want to be part of an awesome team that loves to celebrate a win!




What you‚Äôll do:

We are looking for a Software Engineer with a growing focus on Machine Learning who will contribute to building scalable, efficient back-end systems while also gaining hands-on experience designing and deploying ML models. This role is ideal for a software engineer eager to explore AI-driven solutions and develop their skills in cutting-edge technologies.

You will work closely with data scientists, product managers, and engineers to design robust back-end applications and gradually integrate advanced ML models into production environments. If you are a curious and adaptable software engineer ready to develop your skills in both back-end development and AI, this is the perfect role to propel your career forward. Join us and grow into a key contributor to innovation in automotive, mobility and logistics!




Requirements

¬∑ Academic Background: A degree in Software Engineering, or a related field, with a focus on AI and software development.

¬∑ Technical Expertise:

o Proficiency in back-end development using OO programming languages like Python or Java. Experience with efficient programming languages like Rust is a plus.

o Solid understanding of building scalable and maintainable APIs and microservices.

o Hands-on experience designing and deploying ML/AI models with frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.

o Familiarity with Explainability AI (XAI) to create interpretable and transparent ML solutions.

o Knowledge in building applications powered by LLMs, leveraging RAG and agent-based frameworks.

¬∑ DevOps & Infrastructure: Experience with containerization tools like Docker, version control systems (Git), and CI/CD pipelines.

¬∑ Problem-Solving: Proven ability to integrate ML solutions into production-grade software systems.

¬∑ Collaboration: Strong communication skills to work seamlessly with cross-functional teams, including product managers, data scientists, and engineers.




If you think you are a good match for this position, then let us know about you and send us your CV: jobs@mosaicfactor.com

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.



We are looking for a Machine Learning Scientist to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the traveller's journey for millions of holidaymakers. If you are a motivated machine learning scientist who loves to work with challenging real-world problems on big data, keep reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.





Job Description



Job Title - Machine Learning Scientist



Working model - Full remote from Spain



Team - you will join the Strategic Analytics team within the Technology department.



Contract - Permanent - full-time (36 h/week)







What your impact will be:



Develop real-time machine learning solutions to deal with challenging real-world problems on big data
Develop Dynamic Pricing algorithms based on reinforcement learning
Collaborate in a cross-functional team, including machine learning scientists, software engineers, machine learning engineers, and project managers


Qualifications



Your expertise:



A Ph.D. in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics, or a Master's degree with a minimum of 3 years of experience in the field of machine learning.
Excellent knowledge of Supervised methods (Classification, Regression) and Unsupervised methods (Clustering, Feature Selection, Dimensionality Reduction)
Experience in Reinforcement Learning (Multi-Armed Bandit and Markov Decision Process)
Good knowledge of Python and SQL, with knowledge of the most important Python libraries for Machine Learning and Data Analysis (scikit-learn, Pandas, matplotlib, Numpy, Scipy, MLflow)
Experience with Deep Learning (Recurrent Neural Networks, Convolutional Neural Networks, and Autoencoders)
Experience with Keras (and TensorFlow) or PyTorch


Desirable:



Able to find creative solutions to interesting problems
Curious with a constant desire to learn and collaborate
Previous experience with dynamic pricing algorithms


Additional Information



How we work together:
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you‚Äôll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations

How we learn together:
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.
- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O‚Äôreilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content

Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.) in line with local laws.


Wish you were here? We do, too!







Selection process steps*:



- HR interview (30 minutes)
- 1st interview (Manager 1 hour): Machine learning + Python coding
- 2nd interview (Director 45 min): Soft skills + machine learning knowledge
- Offer extended
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)







Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging



At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.



Eligibility criteria:
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.







Please submit your resume in English
Please submit your resume in English

Title: Data Scientist (Full Remote within Spain)
Description:
ABOUT US



At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.¬†

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!


ABOUT THE ROLE



Due to continuous growth, our Business Intelligence team is excited to welcome a motivated Data Scientist to help us align our work with business goals to drive organizational success.

As a Data Scientist, you'll play a vital role in big data analysis and be responsible for maintaining and enhance data quality. Working closely with key stakeholders, you'll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on both our products and processes.

If you're passionate about solving complex problems, collaborating across departments, and driving results, this role is perfect for you!



YOUR MISSION



As a Data Scinetist at Leadtech, you will:

Conduct thorough data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and improvement opportunities within datasets.
Create effective reports and visualizations to communicate key findings to the company's teams and support data-informed decision-making.
Calculate and apply algorithms to predict Customer Lifetime Value (CLTV).
Collaborate closely with business intelligence specialists, data scientists and other team members to develop predictive models and data-driven solutions.
Perform ad-hoc research to address specific business-related questions.
Continually maintain and enhance data quality, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Participate in the identification and collection of new data relevant to business objectives.
Contribute to the evaluation of new tools and technologies for data management and analysis.
Strong analytical skills
Outstanding oral and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills



Requirements


WHAT WILL MAKE YOU STAND OUT FROM THE CROWD



We're looking for someone with a balance of hard and soft skills who can thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional environment. Here's what we'd love to see:

Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering (Industrial Engineering, Telecommunications Engineering), or a similar discipline.
Demonstrated experience in Data Science environment.
Solid knowledge of data science/analysis tools, such as KNIME, SPSS, or similar tools.
Ability to develop, train, and optimize machine learning models.
Experience in predictive modeling, time series analysis, or cluster analysis.
Experience in calculating and applying algorithms to predict Customer Lifetime Value (CLTV).
Ability to tackle complex problems, identify patterns, and design creative data-driven solutions.
Commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest trends in technology and data science.
Experience with databases and query languages, such as SQL.
Ability to create effective visualizations using tools like Qlik Sense, QlikView or similar.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Proactive attitude and results-oriented.



Benefits


WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?



Growth and career development

At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities.

Work-Life balance

Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!

Comprehensive benefits

Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services).
25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!

Unique Perks

If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views.
Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary.



Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences



Equal Employment Opportunity Employer:

"Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!"

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: GESTOR/A DATA SCIENTIST MODELOS IA BCN/MADRID
Description:
Descripci√≥n del puesto: ¬øQu√© proyectos desarrollamos?

¬†

El objetivo de esta convocatoria es cubrir una vacante de Gestor/a en 17509 ‚Äì Modelos de gesti√≥n de riesgos en el equipo de Modelos de Inteligencia Artificial de Riesgos. Las principales tareas que desarrolla el equipo del departamento son las siguientes:¬†

¬†

An√°lisis de datos para la toma de decisiones de gesti√≥n del riesgo de cr√©dito.
Modelos de scoring y rating para la estimaci√≥n del riesgo de cr√©dito de las operaciones de activo. Modelos de seguimiento del riesgo, de identificaci√≥n del deterioro y modelos para la gesti√≥n de recuperaciones y morosidad.
An√°lisis de nuevas metodolog√≠as, nuevas fuentes de datos y nuevas herramientas con el objetivo de mejorar las herramientas para la toma de decisiones de concesi√≥n, pricing y seguimiento del riesgo.
Definici√≥n y mantenimiento de las m√©tricas y herramientas de riesgo de cr√©dito en sus usos de gesti√≥n: fijaci√≥n de precios, rentabilidad ajustada al riesgo, seguimiento de la calidad crediticia de la cartera, capital econ√≥mico, etc.
Da soporte a los usuarios de los modelos y m√©tricas de riesgo en los distintos √°mbitos donde aplican. An√°lisis adhoc, seguimiento, dudas puntuales, soporte al buz√≥n de Medidas de Riesgo.

¬†

El puesto de trabajo ser√≠a en Servicios Centrales de Madrid o Barcelona.

¬†

Los proyectos que asumir√°s en la posici√≥n son:

¬†

Desarrollo y mantenimiento de los modelos de calificaci√≥n crediticia para cubrir todo el ciclo de vida del cr√©dito (preconcesi√≥n, admisi√≥n, seguimiento, alertas, recuperaciones y morosidad) y para todas las carteras (particulares, aut√≥nomos, PYME, PYME Promotor).
Definici√≥n de requerimientos de implantaci√≥n de variables y modelos.
Soporte a las √°reas de negocio en el uso de los modelos internos de medici√≥n de riesgo de cr√©dito: identificaci√≥n de las necesidades, obtenci√≥n de datos, an√°lisis y conclusiones.
Proyectos de analytics y modelizaci√≥n para la mejora de los procesos de gesti√≥n de riesgos.
An√°lisis de fuentes de nuevas fuentes de informaci√≥n, nuevas metodolog√≠as avanzadas de modelizaci√≥n, nuevas herramientas para la explotaci√≥n de datos y construcci√≥n de modelos.
Identificaci√≥n de √°reas con potenciales mejoras en los procesos y herramientas de modelizaci√≥n.
An√°lisis de herramientas externas para la mejora de los procesos de gesti√≥n de riesgos.
Soporte a los entornos de control en el desarrollo de sus funciones.
Participaci√≥n en proyectos transversales para acelerar la transformaci√≥n digital.
Descripci√≥n del perfil: Requisitos m√≠nimos

¬†

Licenciatura/Ingenier√≠a/M√°ster universitario con perfil cuantitativo y de explotaci√≥n de bases de datos (Matem√°ticas, F√≠sica, Econ√≥micas, Estad√≠stica, Telecomunicaci√≥n, Inform√°tica, Data Science).
