Validar i implementar algorismes predictius de s√®psia aplicant t√®cniques d'aprenentatge autom√†tic per agrupar traject√≤ries de pacients de UCIP segons els resultats.
  • Hematologia; hemof√≠lia: El cas d'√∫s cl√≠nic 3 desenvolupar√† i provar√† un algorisme de predicci√≥ basat en Machine Learning en conjunts de dades de GOSH, HUS, FSJD i ERASMUS per tractar pacients pedi√†trics amb hemof√≠lia A o B. Aquest cas d'√∫s pret√©n mostrar que l'ecosistema d'intercanvi de dades de nova creaci√≥, mitjan√ßant algorismes d'aprenentatge federats, augmenta el nombre de pacients inclosos en algorismes d'aprenentatge autom√†tic en malalties de baixa incid√®ncia. Millorarem la precisi√≥ d'un algorisme d'aprenentatge autom√†tic creat per un √∫nic centre (ERASMUS) per predir els nivells de factor plasm√†tic a l'hemof√≠lia A i B ampliant la validaci√≥ als altres 3 centres. Tamb√© millorarem els models de farmacocin√®tica (PK) existents per predir els nivells de factor plasm√†tic. Finalment, compararem el rendiment dels models d'aprenentatge autom√†tic amb els models cl√†ssics de PK per predir els nivells de factor plasm√†tic.


L'objectiu d'aquest lloc de treball √©s incorporar un/a data scientist a l‚Äôequip multidisciplinar del projecte per donar suport transversal als tres casos d‚Äô√∫s cl√≠nics en qu√® el HSJD participa. Per√≤ especialment en el desenvolupament del algoritme de predicci√≥ de Sepsis en UCIP.

EL PROJECTE A DESENVOLUPAR:

Donar suport al projecte PHEMS com a referent bioinform√†tic en la preparaci√≥ de les bases de dades dels 3 casos de us i en el desenvolupament e implementaci√≥ de models predictius de SEPSIS en UCIP, coordinat amb els 4 hospitals de refer√®ncia pedi√†trics.

LES RESPONSABILITATS:

  • Extracci√≥ i harmonitzaci√≥ de les dades per a la construcci√≥ dades dels entorns de virtualitzaci√≥ necess√†ris pel projecte.
  • Utilitzaci√≥ de les eines de preprocessat i an√†lisi de dades per donar resposta a les necessitats del projecte.
  • Desenvolupament i validaci√≥ d‚Äôalgoritmes predictius explicables per a la predicci√≥ del risc de deteriorament de pacients i la seva estratificaci√≥ segons risc.
  • Col¬∑laboraci√≥ en el disseny de les eines de visualitzaci√≥ per a la presentaci√≥ d‚Äôinformaci√≥ amb els entorns definits per l¬¥organitzaci√≥.
  • Col¬∑laboraci√≥ en el posada en producci√≥ del algoritme un cop validat, pel seu √∫s en un entorn cl√≠nic real.
  • Gestionar, coordinar i impartir las formacions relacionades amb les seves tasques i √†rees de coneixement al personal que els requereixi.
  • Donar suport a les √†rees t√®cniques i assistencials que formin part de l‚Äô√†mbit d‚Äôactuaci√≥.
  • Assistir a les reunions de coordinaci√≥ transversal del projecte en qu√® estigui involucrada.
  • Reportar l‚Äôactivitat del seu √†mbit d‚Äôactuaci√≥, garantint l‚Äôalineaci√≥ dels indicadors de resultats amb els objectius tant assistencials com estrat√®gics de l‚Äô√†rea on treballi.
  • Contribuir als entregables del projecte Europeu amb els resultats i documentaci√≥ generada del projecte
  • Participaci√≥ i coordinaci√≥ en les reunions de seguiment i equip del projecte.


Requisits:

Estar en possessi√≥ del t√≠tol de Bioenginyeria, Enginyeria Inform√†tica, Enginyeria Telecomunicacions, F√≠sica, Matem√†tiques o equivalent.

Experi√®ncia pr√®via com a data scientist en el desenvolupament, validaci√≥ i posterior implementaci√≥ d‚Äôalgorismes de machine learning en l‚Äô√†mbit m√®dic. Es valorar√† positivament tenir experi√®ncia en est√†ndards de dades de recerca cl√≠nica OMOP.

Tenir les compet√®ncies relacionades amb les nostres necessitats.

VALOREM:

  • M√†ster o coneixements en les diferents branques de data science, processat de dades Machine learning i intel¬∑lig√®ncia artificial aplicada a la salud o bioenginyeria.
  • M√†ster o coneixements en tractament de dades (big data & data science), algor√≠smia, tecnologies de monitoritzaci√≥ i imatge.
  • Coneixements de llenguatges de programaci√≥ (Python principalment, es valorar√† altres com Matlab, C++, Java).
  • Coneixements de llenguatges de programaci√≥ de base de dades (SQL).
  • Coneixements o experi√®ncia pr√®via en sistemes cloud (AWS).
  • Experi√®ncia desenvolupament models predictius mitjan√ßant algorismes d‚Äôaprenentatge autom√†tic
  • Es valorar√† positivament l‚Äôexperi√®ncia amb el tractament de dades cl√≠niques d‚Äôentorn real hospitalari i amb est√†ndards OMOP.
  • Es valorar√† positivament estades a l‚Äôestranger cursant formacions o desenvolupant activitat professional.
  • Idiomes: Angl√®s, Catal√† i Castell√†.


Qu√© Oferim

  • Jornada completa (37,5hores setmanals)
  • Descomptes als menjadors de refer√®ncia.
  • Incorporaci√≥ a un equip din√†mic.

Contar√°s con un/a gu√≠a (advisor) que te ayudar√° a construir tu camino dentro de un bootcamp exclusivo y te√±ido de √∫ltimas soluciones tecnol√≥gicas. ¬øSabes con qui√©n compartir√°s universo? Con la familia de Data & Analytics. Ser el cerebro en la toma de decisiones dentro de proyectos donde disfrutar√°s con el end-to-end de la gesti√≥n del dato. ¬°Sigue el camino Pathfinder y descubre esto y mucho m√°s!

Formaci√≥n adaptada a tus necesidades y preferencias. Desde nuestra Universidad Corporativa podr√°s realizar certificaciones, cursos de idiomas, de habilidades de gesti√≥n, t√©cnicas y acceso a Udemy.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.




Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users‚Äô privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We‚Äôre fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.




Your Challenge

As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client‚Äôs advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.




Our core values

Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




Tech Stack

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks

Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K‚Ç¨ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Macbook Pro M3




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!




At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Lead Data Scientist (Artificial Intelligence) - ‚Ç¨87k + 10% bonus
Description:
Are you a Senior or Lead Data Scientist (with AI experience) who's ready to move into a Principal role? We have 3 new openings paying ‚Ç¨87k + 10% bonus




Industry: AI software for Pharma, start-up - heavily backed by a global investor

Workplace: Hybrid - 2 days per week

Offices: Barcelona or Madrid




Our client, the AI tech firm, are helping change the world of Pharma. 2025 is going to be a very busy year and we need 3 Lead Data Scientists who are ready for their next move in either Madrid or Barcelona. You don't need to have managed / led teams, but you will need to have experience mentoring & coaching.




Question tiiiiiime.....

Do you know how the data you're working with effects the business? This question is KEY.

Do you have a passion/interest for Tech / AI and see how it can help improve Healthcare?

Are you a people-person and someone who can work in an start-up, nimble environment?




Tech stack / experience needed:

Python, R, SQL
Lead an AI lab and develop AI products
OO programming - APUI's, AWS Lambda, crontab
4+ years Machine Learning methodologies
Business acumen, experience with stakeholders
Experience with embeddings, genAI and some LLM fine tuning
Calibration of unbalanced problems, RF vs XGB, data leakage with oversampling
PhD or Masters in Data Science / Engineering / Mathematics
AWS experience is a bonus




The AI platform is literally flying off the shelf and the leading Pharma's in the market are knocking on their door as nobody else can do what they can. Come and join this rocket-ship, be part of something that is genuinely improving the world around us, using Artificial Intelligence.




Message me on here and we can discuss the company and position in more detail - matt@hawksworthuk.com




I look forward to hearing from you.




#artificialintelligence #datascience #pharma #munich #madrid #barcelona #gamechanging

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.



We are looking for a Machine Learning Scientist to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the traveller's journey for millions of holidaymakers. If you are a motivated machine learning scientist who loves to work with challenging real-world problems on big data, keep reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.





Job Description



Job Title - Machine Learning Scientist



Working model - Full remote from Spain



Team - you will join the Strategic Analytics team within the Technology department.



Contract - Permanent - full-time (36 h/week)







What your impact will be:



Develop real-time machine learning solutions to deal with challenging real-world problems on big data
Develop Dynamic Pricing algorithms based on reinforcement learning
Collaborate in a cross-functional team, including machine learning scientists, software engineers, machine learning engineers, and project managers


Qualifications



Your expertise:



A Ph.D. in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics, or a Master's degree with a minimum of 3 years of experience in the field of machine learning.
Excellent knowledge of Supervised methods (Classification, Regression) and Unsupervised methods (Clustering, Feature Selection, Dimensionality Reduction)
Experience in Reinforcement Learning (Multi-Armed Bandit and Markov Decision Process)
Good knowledge of Python and SQL, with knowledge of the most important Python libraries for Machine Learning and Data Analysis (scikit-learn, Pandas, matplotlib, Numpy, Scipy, MLflow)
Experience with Deep Learning (Recurrent Neural Networks, Convolutional Neural Networks, and Autoencoders)
Experience with Keras (and TensorFlow) or PyTorch


Desirable:



Able to find creative solutions to interesting problems
Curious with a constant desire to learn and collaborate
Previous experience with dynamic pricing algorithms


Additional Information



How we work together:
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you‚Äôll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations

How we learn together:
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

HTML:
At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Scientist to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the traveller's journey for millions of holidaymakers. If you are a motivated machine learning scientist who loves to work with challenging real-world problems on big data, keep reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.



Job Description

Job Title - Machine Learning Scientist

Working model - Full remote from Spain

Team - you will join the Strategic Analytics team within the Technology department.

Contract - Permanent - full-time (36 h/week)



What your impact will be:

  • Develop real-time machine learning solutions to deal with challenging real-world problems on big data
  • Develop Dynamic Pricing algorithms based on reinforcement learning
  • Collaborate in a cross-functional team, including machine learning scientists, software engineers, machine learning engineers, and project managers

Qualifications

Your expertise:

  • A Ph.D. in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics, or a Master's degree with a minimum of 3 years of experience in the field of machine learning.
  • Excellent knowledge of Supervised methods (Classification, Regression) and Unsupervised methods (Clustering, Feature Selection, Dimensionality Reduction)
  • Experience in Reinforcement Learning (Multi-Armed Bandit and Markov Decision Process)
  • Good knowledge of Python and SQL, with knowledge of the most important Python libraries for Machine Learning and Data Analysis (scikit-learn, Pandas, matplotlib, Numpy, Scipy, MLflow)
  • Experience with Deep Learning (Recurrent Neural Networks, Convolutional Neural Networks, and Autoencoders)
  • Experience with Keras (and TensorFlow) or PyTorch


Desirable:

  • Able to find creative solutions to interesting problems
  • Curious with a constant desire to learn and collaborate
  • Previous experience with dynamic pricing algorithms

Additional Information

How we work together:
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you‚Äôll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations

How we learn together:
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.
- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O‚Äôreilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content

Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.) in line with local laws.


Wish you were here? We do, too!



Selection process steps*:

- HR interview (30 minutes)
- 1st interview (Manager 1 hour): Machine learning + Python coding
- 2nd interview (Director 45 min): Soft skills + machine learning knowledge
- Offer extended
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.




Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users‚Äô privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We‚Äôre fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.




Your Challenge

As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client‚Äôs advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.




Our core values

Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




Tech Stack

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks

Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K‚Ç¨ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Macbook Pro M3




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!




At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Industry: AI software for Pharma, start-up - heavily backed by a global investor

Our client, the AI tech firm, are helping change the world of Pharma. 2025 is going to be a very busy year and we need 3 Lead Data Scientists who are ready for their next move in either Madrid or Barcelona. You don't need to have managed / led teams, but you will need to have experience mentoring & coaching.

Do you know how the data you're working with effects the business? This question is KEY.

4+ years Machine Learning methodologies

Title: AI Scientist ll
Description:
At Talkdesk, we are courageous innovators focused on redefining the customer experience, making the impossible possible for companies globally. We champion an inclusive and diverse culture representative of the communities in which we live and serve. And, we give back to our community by volunteering our time, supporting non-profits, and minimizing our global footprint. Each day, thousands of employees, customers, and partners all over the world trust Talkdesk to deliver a better way to great experiences.




We are recognized as a cloud contact center leader by many of the most influential research organizations, including Gartner and Forrester. With $498 million in total funding, a valuation of more than $10 Billion, and a ranking of #16 on the Forbes Cloud 100 list, now is the time to be part of the Talkdesk legacy to help accelerate our success in a new decade of transformational growth.




At Talkdesk, we embrace FAST, our fundamental operating principles that define who we are as an organization. These principles drive us to make the impossible possible. FAST: Focus + Accountability + Speed = Talkdesker.





Focus: Focus time, energy and attention on what is most impactful for the business and thoughtful about how and when to partner with others.


Accountability: Hold self and others accountable to meet commitments and drive results. Accept responsibility for successes and failures.


Speed: Execute with agility and urgency. Act promptly, decisively, and without delay. Make good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.


Talkdesker: YOU!



What are we doing?




At Talkdesk we are reimagining how people experience contact centers, helping our customers create long lasting and meaningful relations with their customers. The capacity to make sense of the message that is being conveyed when we communicate has been reserved to humans alone, but we are building the next generation of solutions that will mimic our ability to understand language, ensuring that the customer needs are always well understood and efficiently handled. We are a growing team of curious and talented people that are focused on leveraging the power of Speech Recognition, Natural Language Processing, audio signal processing, and machine learning, to deliver added value to our customers.¬†




What do we need?




We are looking for a talented Data Scientist. We need someone that is a natural problem solver, who likes to be challenged, has the drive to explore and is committed to quality. We expect you to be a truly team player, reliable and easy to communicate with. You will have to leverage different techniques to deliver state of the art solutions around natural language understanding and generation. More specifically, you will have to:





Focus on delivering working and robust products/models to production. We focus more on research engineering to bridge the gap between capabilities and products. We‚Äôre looking for data scientists who geek out on solving business problems and impacting millions of people‚Äôs daily lives.


Explore, clean and transform large datasets of unstructured data;


Analyze complex problems and recommend adequate solutions according to the identified requirements;


Apply, combine and fine-tune different Natural Language Processing/Understanding techniques to achieve the best results;


Design, implement and maintain scalable and performant architectures to support the idealized solutions.





What are we looking for?





Experience developing, delivering and operating Artificial Intelligence- / machine learning-based software in production in the cloud.¬†


Fluency in Python and familiarity with Java or Scala


Relevant experience with NLP/Speech tasks (e.g. Natural Language Understanding, Information Retrieval, Recommender Systems, Topic Modeling, Speech Recognition, Speaker Diarization, Text-to-Speech etc);


Familiarity with supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms (e.g., neural networks, SVM, decision trees, clustering);


Familiarity with generative language models (including prompt engineering, fine-tuning and monitoring) and related frameworks (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex, NeMo);


Familiarity with Big Data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc).


Excellent skills in design, debugging, and problem-solving. Passion for customers, innovation, product quality, service excellence and test engineering



Work Environment and Physical Requirements:




Primarily office-environment work, extended periods of sitting or standing, computer-based work. Limited lifting, and equipment usage limited to computer-related equipment (keyboards, mouse, etc.)


The Talkdesk story hinges on empathy and acceptance. It is the shared goal among all Talkdeskers to empower a new kind of customer hero through our innovative software solution, and we firmly believe that the best path to success for our mission is inclusivity, diversity, and genuine acceptance. To that end, we will hire, promote, work along, cheer for, bond with, and warmly welcome into the Talkdesk family all persons without regard to ethnic and racial identity, indigenous heritage, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.
Show more
HTML:
At Talkdesk, we are courageous innovators focused on redefining the customer experience, making the impossible possible for companies globally. We champion an inclusive and diverse culture representative of the communities in which we live and serve. And, we give back to our community by volunteering our time, supporting non-profits, and minimizing our global footprint. Each day, thousands of employees, customers, and partners all over the world trust Talkdesk to deliver a better way to great experiences.


We are recognized as a cloud contact center leader by many of the most influential research organizations, including Gartner and Forrester. With $498 million in total funding, a valuation of more than $10 Billion, and a ranking of #16 on the Forbes Cloud 100 list, now is the time to be part of the Talkdesk legacy to help accelerate our success in a new decade of transformational growth.


At Talkdesk, we embrace FAST, our fundamental operating principles that define who we are as an organization. These principles drive us to make the impossible possible. FAST: Focus + Accountability + Speed = Talkdesker.



  • Focus: Focus time, energy and attention on what is most impactful for the business and thoughtful about how and when to partner with others.

  • Accountability: Hold self and others accountable to meet commitments and drive results. Accept responsibility for successes and failures.

  • Speed: Execute with agility and urgency. Act promptly, decisively, and without delay. Make good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.

  • Talkdesker: YOU!

What are we doing?


At Talkdesk we are reimagining how people experience contact centers, helping our customers create long lasting and meaningful relations with their customers. The capacity to make sense of the message that is being conveyed when we communicate has been reserved to humans alone, but we are building the next generation of solutions that will mimic our ability to understand language, ensuring that the customer needs are always well understood and efficiently handled. We are a growing team of curious and talented people that are focused on leveraging the power of Speech Recognition, Natural Language Processing, audio signal processing, and machine learning, to deliver added value to our customers. 


What do we need?


We are looking for a talented Data Scientist. We need someone that is a natural problem solver, who likes to be challenged, has the drive to explore and is committed to quality. We expect you to be a truly team player, reliable and easy to communicate with. You will have to leverage different techniques to deliver state of the art solutions around natural language understanding and generation. More specifically, you will have to:



  • Focus on delivering working and robust products/models to production. We focus more on research engineering to bridge the gap between capabilities and products. We‚Äôre looking for data scientists who geek out on solving business problems and impacting millions of people‚Äôs daily lives.

  • Explore, clean and transform large datasets of unstructured data;

  • Analyze complex problems and recommend adequate solutions according to the identified requirements;

  • Apply, combine and fine-tune different Natural Language Processing/Understanding techniques to achieve the best results;

  • Design, implement and maintain scalable and performant architectures to support the idealized solutions.


What are we looking for?



  • Experience developing, delivering and operating Artificial Intelligence- / machine learning-based software in production in the cloud. 

  • Fluency in Python and familiarity with Java or Scala

  • Relevant experience with NLP/Speech tasks (e.g. Natural Language Understanding, Information Retrieval, Recommender Systems, Topic Modeling, Speech Recognition, Speaker Diarization, Text-to-Speech etc);

  • Familiarity with supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms (e.g., neural networks, SVM, decision trees, clustering);

  • Familiarity with generative language models (including prompt engineering, fine-tuning and monitoring) and related frameworks (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex, NeMo);

  • Familiarity with Big Data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc).

  • Excellent skills in design, debugging, and problem-solving. Passion for customers, innovation, product quality, service excellence and test engineering

Work Environment and Physical Requirements:


Primarily office-environment work, extended periods of sitting or standing, computer-based work. Limited lifting, and equipment usage limited to computer-related equipment (keyboards, mouse, etc.)


The Talkdesk story hinges on empathy and acceptance. It is the shared goal among all Talkdeskers to empower a new kind of customer hero through our innovative software solution, and we firmly believe that the best path to success for our mission is inclusivity, diversity, and genuine acceptance. To that end, we will hire, promote, work along, cheer for, bond with, and warmly welcome into the Talkdesk family all persons without regard to ethnic and racial identity, indigenous heritage, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Purpose

As a Data Scientist, you will analyse and interpret US healthcare claims and insurance plan-level data using SQL and Python to assess prescription patterns, patient treatment journey, prescriber landscape, insurance coverage across the competitor landscape, as well as possible unmet need and market size. You will provide strategic insights and inform the commercialization and go-to-market strategy for MoonLake, set up and operate the analytics infrastructure for MoonLake Commercial across several data sources and platforms and drive additional data and insights related cross-functional projects, such as scientific papers.

Key Responsibilities


Leverage SQL and Python for efficient data extraction, manipulation, and interpretation for patient claims and plan-level insurance data, e.g.:
Conduct in-depth analysis of patient lifetime treatment journey.
Evaluate healthcare practitioner activity across the market.
Analyse US healthcare claims data to evaluate market presence and trends among competitors.
Analyse healthcare insurance plan-level data to assess prescription market coverage.
Merge and harmonize multiple data sources for advanced analytics.
Identify gaps and opportunities in competitor insurance coverage and market positioning.
Ensure data quality and integrity during analysis to support accurate reporting.
Document all processes, experiments, data sources and analyses to ensure a robust and reproducible infrastructure.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver actionable insights on market trends.
Provide strategic recommendations based on data analysis to inform business decisions.
Create and maintain dashboards or reports to monitor key metrics and market performance, as well as visualize advanced analytics outcomes.

Your profile

Education


Masters in Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent.


Experience


2+ years of experience as Data Scientist in relevant field


Skills/knowledge/behavioural Competencies


SQL, Python, Pandas, SkLearn, NLP, Power BI, Git, Data Visualization
Adaptable and able to thrive in fast-paced environments.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to manage priorities effectively.


Work Location:


2 days a week in our brand new Cambridge or Porto office


Why us?

An exciting job opportunity awaits!

MoonLake is a dynamic and innovative company pushing the boundaries of possibility, and we are looking for passionate individuals to join our stellar team.

What We Offer

Learning Environment: An opportunity to learn and grow alongside experienced professionals in a supportive and innovative biotech environment.

Impactful Work: Contribute to ground-breaking projects that have the potential to transform global healthcare.

Flexibility and Balance: Work remotely/hybrid, enjoying a healthy work-life balance while making meaningful contributions to our team.

Career Growth: A clear path for career progression, with the chance to take on more responsibilities as you develop your skills.

Our Core Values

We look for potential MoonLakers that embody our three core values that drive our pursuit of excellence:

We do Stellar Science: We aspire to create novel therapies that elevate treatment horizons, with innovative science, and high quality, always.

We go beyond: We aspire to be positively disruptive in our field, and bold in the way we challenge the norms and each other.

We unlock value: We aspire to create long-term value for investors and communities.

About Us

MoonLake Immunotherapeutics is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company unlocking the potential of sonelokimab, a novel investigational Nanobody¬Æ for the treatment of the inflammatory disease, to revolutionize outcomes for patients.

We continue to make significant progress in our Global Clinical Development Programs. The company‚Äôs focus is on inflammatory diseases with a major unmet need, including hidradenitis suppurativa and psoriatic arthritis ‚Äì conditions affecting millions of people worldwide with a large need for improved treatment options. MoonLake was founded in 2021 and is headquarted in Zug, with hubs in Cambridge & Porto.

Further information is available at www.moonlaketx.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Scientist

Seniority: Senior (5+ years)

Type of position: Must be in Oporto. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in data science or a related role.
Proficient in Python and its data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly).
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and statistical methods.
Experience with SQL and database management for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, or GCP) and big data technologies is a plus.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a strong attention to detail.
Fluency in English (written and spoken) is required.




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Scientist for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

  • A higher education degree (BAC+5 level) with a specialization in Data Science;
  • At least 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist;
  • You are proficient in Python and API integration;
  • Solid knowledge of Big Data technologies (Hadoop) and AI, including Named Entity Recognition (NER), Natural Language Processing (NLP), computer vision and clustering.
  • You have a strong passion for artificial intelligence and demonstrate excellent teamwork skills;
  • Your rigor, organizational abilities and motivation to tackle complex challenges set you apart;
  • Fluent English (mandatory);
  • The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
üöÄ Calling All Senior Research Data Scientists! üöÄ




üí° Freelance | Contract Opportunity | Deep Tech + Personalised Medicine




Are you ready to revolutionise the future of medicine? üåç We're on the hunt for a Senior Research Data Scientist with a passion for Machine Learning, Bioinformatics, and Personalised Medicine to collaborate with our pioneering deep-tech startup.




This is your chance to work on cutting-edge technology that predicts medical conditions using advanced models derived from proprietary biomedical and photonic signal data. Join us in building the world‚Äôs best AI-powered diagnostics platform‚Äîone innovation at a time. üíªüî¨

üí• If you're ready to take on bold challenges, love exploring uncharted datasets, and want to make a real impact on the future of healthcare, this could be your perfect gig.




What You‚Äôll Do as Part of the Team:

‚ú® Take full ownership of end-to-end projects from a data science perspective‚Äîyour work will shape the future!

‚ú® Dive into unique, exclusive datasets and uncover insights that push the boundaries of personalized medicine.

‚ú® Develop cutting-edge algorithms, statistical models, and machine learning techniques that translate data into life-changing discoveries.

‚ú® Collaborate with our visionary head of department and interdisciplinary teams, influencing product development and key decisions with data.

‚ú® Stay at the forefront of advancements in data science, machine learning, and personalized medicine, implementing novel methodologies.

‚ú® Communicate your insights and innovations in a clear, actionable way for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

‚ú® And most importantly‚Ä¶ have fun working with human-derived signals and datasets that no one else has! üéâ




Who We‚Äôre Looking For (You‚Äôll Excel If‚Ä¶):

‚úîÔ∏è You thrive on complex, hands-on data challenges and have a deep understanding of data science.

‚úîÔ∏è You love exploring new types of datasets‚Äîespecially if you‚Äôve worked with omics data (genomics, metabolomics, proteomics, etc.) or have the skills to dive into this field.

‚úîÔ∏è You‚Äôre experienced in handling diverse data types (tabular, time-series, physical signals, etc.).

‚úîÔ∏è You can contribute new algorithms/models to our growing library of disease diagnostics.

‚úîÔ∏è You‚Äôre both an independent problem-solver and a collaborative team player.

‚úîÔ∏è You‚Äôve got a relentless hunger for innovation and a drive to push boundaries.




Your Background Should Include:

üéì PhD (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or a related field. Exceptional Master‚Äôs-level candidates will also be considered.

üìà 3+ years of experience in academia or industry, solving challenging data problems‚Äîpreferably with biomedical signals.




üß¨ Applied research experience with omics data? Even better! (If not, we‚Äôll get you up to speed.)

üöÄ Experience in fast-paced, high-growth environments (bonus points for start-up experience).

üìä Deep expertise in data pre-processing, feature engineering, and exploratory data analysis.

ü§ñ Strong knowledge of statistical methods, predictive modelling, and experimental design.




Why You Should Join Us:

üåü Work on cutting-edge technology with a mission to transform healthcare.

üåü Flexibility to thrive as a freelancer/contractor while collaborating with a world-class team.

üåü Be part of something bigger‚Äîyour work will change lives.

Title: Data Scientist (Mid and Senior) - Fraud and Risk Evaluation
Description:
Hello! We're Teya.

Teya is a payment and software service provider, headquartered in London serving small, local businesses across Europe. Founded in 2019, we build easy to use, integrated tools that enable our members to accept payments and boost business performance.




At Teya we believe small, local businesses are the lifeblood of our communities.

We‚Äôre here because we don‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a level playing field that gives small businesses with a fighting chance against the giants of the high street.

We‚Äôre here because we see banks and legacy service providers making things harder for them. We don‚Äôt think the best technology or the best service should be reserved for those with the biggest headquarters.

We‚Äôre here to fight for a future where small, local businesses can thrive, and to commit the same dedication they offer all of us.




Become a part of our story.

We‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.




Your Mission

You will be part of a joint team of machine learning engineers and data scientists building and evolving ML models, real-time systems, reports, and deep analysis of fraud detection and mitigation activities to protect merchants, their customers, and Teya from illicit activities.

Working with advanced predictive models and scalable software systems, build and grow intelligent solutions to reduce all kinds of risk and allow Teya to focus on effectively serving our merchants.




In This Role, You‚Äôll Be

Helping Teya to use data to drive business decisions
Working on projects including but not limited to fraud detection, transaction monitoring, customer onboarding risk, cost-to-serve and cost-to-acquire modelling
Building predictive models to a production level adopting coding best practices
Working closely with other data scientists and machine learning engineers to support the analytical part of the machine learning lifecycle




Your Story

Background in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Machine Learning,, Statistics, Economics or equivalent)
3+ years of professional working experience
Someone who thrives in developing innovative, state-of-the-art products that can meet and surpass the latest advances in the field
Proficiency in, Amazon SageMaker, SQL, Jupyter Notebook
Experience with Machine Learning and statistical inference.
Understanding of ETL processes and data pipelines and ability to work closely with Machine Learning Engineers for product implementation
Ability to communicate outcomes of a data analysis to business stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to think creatively and insightfully about business problems
Nice to have:
Proficiency in Snowflake.




The Perks

We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
Health Insurance;
Meal Allowance;
25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);
Public Transportation Card;
Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;
Office snacks every day;
Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.

+4 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist;

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH üë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

Hostelworld is structured differently than most tech companies in world, as we do not have an Engineering or Product department. Instead, we have ‚ÄúGrowth Teams‚Äù which are full stack groups that are organised into cross functional squads. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a key role in shaping the Data Science Growth Team progress on building products that help travellers find the right inventory of hostels and experiences.




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Translate business and customers problems into machine learning solutions.
Defining hypotheses, measure and monitor the success.
Propose, design, build, maintain and push machine learning solutions into production.
Express and communicate the business and technical impact of the machine learning solutions to a variety of audiences.
Responsible for the end-to-end process of designing and running experiments to serving production models at scale.
Ensure that the solutions are maintainable, performant, scalable and debuggable.
Automate and abstract away different repeatable routines that are present in most machine learning tasks.
Provide support to software engineers and product managers building machine learning solutions.
Bring the best software development and infrastructure practices to the data science squad.




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

Experience & Qualifications:

Proficiency in machine learning concepts such as data exploration, feature engineering, model selection, training and testing.
Proven experience in productization of machine learning solutions ‚Äì libraries, packages, REST APIs, serving and monitoring.
Familiarity with ranking, recommender systems, and natural language understanding.
Familiarity with deep learning.

Knowledge & Skills:

Proficiency programming in Python and SQL-like databases.
You are proficient in at least one of the following machine learning tasks ‚Äì classification, regression or clustering.
You are familiar with at least two of the following libraries or packages ‚Äì scikit-learn, pandas, Spark MLlib, TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Ability to carefully design solutions that scale with increasing volumes of data.
Ability to follow software engineering best practices, including requirements analysis, system design, modularity, version control, testing and documentation




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days







We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




THE ROLE & THE TEAMüë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

During 2020, Hostelworld pivoted from a more traditional functional CMO/CPO/CTO organisation to a ‚Äòfull ownership‚Äù growth team plus platform team model. More specifically, we established four growth teams to cover all consumer /hostel facing Apps and channels that reported into the CPO; and a separate CTO organisation that became responsible for supplying and maintaining common core services (such as inventory pricing, availability and checkout) via APIs to these four growth teams. Each of these four growth teams comprise resources that report into the CPO and dedicated resources drawn from the engineering function (developers, QA resources) and analytics function. Collectively, these four growth teams comprise ~ 50 headcount and are wholly accountable for their KPIs and roadmaps




We currently have four growth teams and four further central/support teams as follows;

Paid performance team : responsible for growing and optimising our paid web channels, including (web) landing page optimisation
Core team : responsible for our progressive web app (PWA Website), our organic web channels such as SEO, and more generally our core OTA funnel performance
Mobile/Social team : responsible for our iOS and Android Apps, including paid and organic downloads, CRM strategy and more generally our social network and event management (LinkUps) platforms
Supply team : responsible for all our hostel facing platforms and tools, supporting our two sided marketplace through collaboration with our customer facing teams and leading on our inventory, availability and rates position[LR1]
Product Design (Central) team : responsible for defining and implementing a uniform User Interface/Experience design language across our consumer and supplier facing Apps, consistent with our Mission and Brand
Content and Creative (Central) team : responsible for defining and leading the creative direction for Hostelworld, delivering content primarily through the four Growth teams above but also supporting the wider business needs with copywriting, content writing, graphic design and video production assets
Product and Technology Operations (Central) team : primarily responsible for driving alignment and coordination across the Growth and Technology teams quarterly roadmap planning process; and managing vendor spend across these two teams which accounts for the vast majority of non Wages and Salaries expenditure across the company
Customer Service (Support) team : responsible for handling all consumer support queries, mostly via webform/chat and email across 19 languages.




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Stakeholder Collaboration:

Partner with business leaders to identify opportunities for leveraging data science to solve business problems
Work closely with product teams to implement requirements and with engineering to implement algorithms and ETLs.
Coordinate with stakeholders and provide timely deliver

Technical Expertise:

Work closely with a team of machine learning engineers, data engineers and other data scientists to develop best in class search and ranking algorithms

Performance and Impact:

Monitor data product performance and business impact and act accordingly when objectives are not met
Develop comprehensive diagnostic approaches, a/b testing plans and scalable, repeatable best practices for our data science product development and roll out processes

WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

MSc or PhD in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field with a preference for a specialization in machine learning or data science
2-5 years‚Äô experience as data scientist in a digital product environment, ideally ecommerce or two sided marketplace, developing & deploying successful ranking and recommendation algorithms through
Experience across all machine learning workstreams: using large data sets, model development, feature engineering, statistics, experimentation, data visualization, optimization, software development.
Mastery of experimental design, A/B testing, and evaluation metrics for ML models.
Strong skills in Python and in a selection of machine learning libraries (Keras, NumPy, Pandas, Hugging Face), deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch), and big data query languages (Scala, Spark)
Experience conducting exploratory data analysis to understand user search behaviour, data distributions, trends, and potential challenges.
Experience with cloud frameworks like VertexAI.




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days







We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Title: Marketing Data Scientist
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Marketing Data Scientist

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone‚Äôs day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing


Develop Data-Driven Insights: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to extract actionable insights from large and diverse datasets across different European markets, driving strategic marketing decisions and commercial execution optimization.
Utilising ML methods (e.g supervised, unsupervised) on an Azure platform with languages such as Python, build and implement Predictive Models: Design, build, and deploy predictive and machine learning models to identify market trends, customer behaviour, and business process outcomes.
Analyze Multi-Channel Marketing Data: Integrate and analyze data from various marketing channels (e.g., transactional, firmographic, behavioral, digital data from advertising, social media, email campaigns) to assess performance, identify patterns, generate usable segmentations and recommend improvements to amplify future success of activities.
Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with marketing, sales, and data teams to ensure alignment of data science initiatives with business goals. Enable analysts to further work on data points and reach data-driven recommendations to support in strategic planning and decision-making processes.
Ensure compliance to the Machine Learning Lifecycle from Data gathering through to Deployment. Appropriate checks and balances along with sufficient validation steps should be incorporated to maintain Data Quality and Compliance (e.g. GDPR and internal data governance policies)


What Do You Bring With You

The ideal candidate would demonstrate:


Advanced Data Analysis and Modeling: Proficiency in statistical analysis and machine learning techniques, with experience in coding with Python, R, and SQL along with a good knowledge of Databricks is important. Knowledge of tools like Power BI for translating data into insights is a benefit.
Experience with Marketing Analytics: Strong background in analyzing and interpreting marketing data, with knowledge of marketing metrics, customer segmentation, and business performance evaluation.
Multi-Channel Data Integration: Expertise in integrating and analyzing data from various sources, including digital marketing platforms, CRM systems, large transactional databases, to create in depth intelligent views of customer cohorts.
Strong Communication Skills: Ability to clearly communicate complex data findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders, including creating detailed reports, visualizations, and presentations.
Cross-Cultural and Regional Awareness: Understanding of the nuances and variations in marketing practices and consumer behavior across different European markets, with the ability to adapt strategies to diverse regional needs.


What Do We Offer


Attractive compensation package
Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
Employee reduced-rate shipping
Great career opportunities
FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we‚Äôre ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all

Our Company

FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World‚Äôs Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.

Our Philosophy

The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.

Our Culture

Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970‚Äôs. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today‚Äôs global marketplace.
